aboutPage.hero.title: Debt Box Platform
aboutPage.hero.description: Debt Box is the smart solution for managing deferred purchases and tracking debts between merchants and customers easily and transparently. It enables merchants to record deferred purchases, track outstanding amounts, send automatic reminders, and improve cash flow without complexity.
aboutPage.aboutSection.description1: At Debt Box, we offer an innovative solution that enables customers to buy products now and pay later, while providing stores with advanced tools to manage debts and track repayments with ease and transparency.
aboutPage.aboutSection.description2: Our platform is developed to serve the Saudi market in line with the Kingdom's Vision 2030 towards digital transformation and facilitating financial transactions between individuals and stores.
aboutPage.visionSection.title: Our Vision
aboutPage.visionSection.description: At Debt Box, we believe that buying and deferred payment should be easy and secure for everyone. Our vision is to create an integrated digital financial system that makes deferred payment processes a seamless, reliable, and accessible experience across Saudi Arabia. We aspire to be the first choice for every store looking to organize its debts, and for every customer wanting to control their payments without complications.
aboutPage.visionSection.goals.goal1: Empowering stores to easily organize and manage customer debts.
aboutPage.visionSection.goals.goal2: Facilitating users' lives through flexible payment solutions that align with their lifestyles.
aboutPage.visionSection.goals.goal3: Supporting digital transformation in the Kingdom in line with Vision 2030.
aboutPage.missionSection.title: Our Mission
aboutPage.missionSection.description: Our mission at Debt Box is to develop an integrated system that contributes to building a transparent relationship between the seller and the buyer, through an intelligent, user-friendly dashboard that allows stores to issue invoices and track payments, while enabling customers to manage their purchases and pay later with confidence and security.
aboutPage.missionSection.goals.goal1: Providing reliable technical solutions for issuing and tracking deferred invoices.
aboutPage.missionSection.goals.goal2: Ensuring data security and confidentiality of transactions for all users. Promoting a culture of financial commitment between merchants and customers.
aboutPage.missionSection.goals.goal3: Providing a user experience based on simplicity, clarity, and integration.
aboutPage.whyUsSection.title: Why Digit Box?
aboutPage.whyUsSection.features.easeOfUs: The Debt Box interface is designed to be simple and clear, whether you are a customer wanting to track your payments or a store owner looking to manage invoices easily.
aboutPage.whyUsSection.features.highSecu: We use the latest encryption technologies to ensure the protection of your data and transactions, with full compliance with security and privacy standards in Saudi Arabia.
aboutPage.whyUsSection.features.advanced: Track your invoices, customer records, outstanding amounts, and due dates from one place in a smart and organized way.
aboutPage.whyUsSection.features.instantN: We send you automatic reminders before due dates to ensure no delays in payment or collection, maintaining the relationship between the customer and the merchant.
aboutPage.whyUsSection.features.buyOnCre: Offer flexible options for your customers to boost sales, and increase their satisfaction with practical and secure financial facilities.
aboutPage.whyUsSection.features.building: We aim to enhance trust and transparency between the seller and the buyer, through a system that shows all details and provides an accurate record of each transaction.

8. Sanad Issuance and Signature Requirements

Debtbox Platform provides merchants with the capability to issue a Sanad (certificate/document) for transactions conducted through our platform. The following terms strictly govern the issuance and use of Sanad:
8.1 Merchant Responsibility for Sanad Issuance

Merchants registered on the Debtbox Platform have the exclusive right and responsibility to issue Sanad documents for transactions with their customers. The Sanad serves as an official record and proof of the deferred payment agreement between the merchant and the customer.
8.2 Signature Requirements
All Sanad documents issued through the Debtbox Platform MUST include valid signatures from both parties:
Customer Signature: The customer must provide their signature on the Sanad document, acknowledging their acceptance of the deferred payment terms, the amount owed, and the agreed-upon due date.
The signature is mandatory and legally binding. A Sanad without the signature is considered invalid and will not be recognized as a valid document.
8.3 Sanad Validity and Legal Standing

Sanad documents issued through the Debtbox Platform, when properly signed by both parties, constitute legally binding agreements under Saudi Arabian law. These documents may be used as evidence in legal proceedings related to debt collection or dispute resolution.
8.4 Merchant Obligations
Merchants agree to:
Issue Sanad documents accurately and truthfully, reflecting the actual transaction details.
Ensure that all required signatures are obtained before finalizing any Sanad document.
Maintain proper records of all issued Sanad documents in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.
Not issue fraudulent, misleading, or inaccurate Sanad documents.
8.5 Customer Obligations
Customers agree to:
Provide their signature only after verifying the accuracy of transaction details, including the amount owed and due date.
Honor the terms agreed upon in the signed Sanad document.
8.6 Platform Role

Debtbox Platform facilitates the creation and management of Sanad documents but does not act as a party to the agreement between merchants and customers. The Platform is not responsible for the accuracy of information provided by merchants or customers, nor does it guarantee the enforceability of Sanad documents. The Platform's role is limited to providing the technical infrastructure for Sanad issuance and management.

privacyPolicyPage.content.sanadData.desc: When merchants issue Sanad documents through the Debtbox Platform, certain personal data and signature information is collected and processed. This section describes how we handle Sanad-related data:

Merchant identification information and authorized signature
Date and time of Sanad issuance
Digital signatures or signature images provided by both parties

To facilitate the creation and issuance of Sanad documents
To maintain accurate records of transactions and agreements between merchants and customers
To enable both parties to access and retrieve their Sanad documents
To comply with legal and regulatory requirements for financial record-keeping
To assist in dispute resolution and debt collection processes when necessary
privacyPolicyPage.content.sanadData.sign: Signature data is considered highly sensitive personal information. We implement the following security measures:
All signature data is encrypted both in transit and at rest
Access to signature data is restricted to authorized personnel only
Signature data is stored securely and retained in accordance with applicable legal requirements

privacyPolicyPage.content.sanadData.rete: Sanad documents and associated signature data are retained for a period required by applicable Saudi Arabian laws and regulations, which may extend beyond the completion of the transaction. This retention is necessary for legal compliance, dispute resolution, and audit purposes.
privacyPolicyPage.content.sanadData.acce: Both merchants and customers have the right to access their respective Sanad documents through the Debtbox Platform. However, access to signature data of the other party is restricted and may only be accessed when legally required or with explicit consent.
privacyPolicyPage.content.sanadData.disc: We may disclose Sanad-related data in the following circumstances:
To legal authorities when required by law or court order
To authorized representatives of either the merchant or customer with proper verification
In connection with legal proceedings related to the Sanad document
With explicit written consent from both parties to the Sanad agreement
